title: How to Make a Motorcycle Diaper Cake

steps.title: Purchase the colors and styles of the required items that you think the expectant mom would like.
steps.content: Purchase the colors and styles of the required items that you think the expectant mom would like. The following list explains exactly what is needed (also see Things You'll Need below for the crafting items): At least 34 diapers (newborn or early stage) 2 receiving blankets 2 bibs, a chain linked toy (appropriate for a newborn or infant) 1 pair of infant socks 1 baby bottle 1 washcloth 1 plush stuffed toy (that does not contain buttons or any items that could pose a choking hazard).

steps.title: Line the cake pan with folded diapers.
steps.content: Line the cake pan with folded diapers. Start by lining one side and stacking the diapers on their side so they sit upright, but placed horizontally. As you build up one wall side, migrate to the other side of the pan and build up that area.

steps.title: Continue lining the sides of the pan with folded diapers.
steps.content: Continue lining the sides of the pan with folded diapers. Keep creating the swirl shape.

steps.title: Contain the diapers in the pan.
steps.content: Contain the diapers in the pan. Wrap one of the rubber bands or soft elastic loops around the perimeter of the diapers.

steps.title: Lift the diaper "tire" from the pan and carefully place on a hard surface.
steps.content: Lift the diaper "tire" from the pan and carefully place on a hard surface. You may want to ask a friend to help with this because if a single diaper slips from the band, you’ll have to start the process all over again!

steps.title: Create another diaper tire.
steps.content: Create another diaper tire. Do this inside the pan the same way you designed the first swirl. Add the rubber band around the diapers, then gingerly lift the tire from the pan and set next to the first diaper tire.

steps.title: Wrap each diaper tire with the decorative ribbon.
steps.content: Wrap each diaper tire with the decorative ribbon. Cover the rubber band or elastic loop with the ribbon. This improves the look and helps to give the impression of a tire. Pin the ribbon in place, leaving the pin at the bottom of the tire so it doesn’t show.

steps.title: Fold the first receiving blanket in half, length-wise.
steps.content: Fold the first receiving blanket in half, length-wise. If necessary, iron the blanket to remove wrinkles.

steps.title: Roll the blanket into a very tight roll.
steps.content: Roll the blanket into a very tight roll. The roll must be tight enough to fit in the middle of the diaper tire hole. Pin the blanket roll in place.

steps.title: Slide the rolled blanket through the diaper tire hole.
steps.content: Slide the rolled blanket through the diaper tire hole. Match the ends so the blanket is hanging out half and half. The roll must remain in place, so pin each end of the blanket if necessary.

steps.title: Stand the diaper tire on its side (so it now looks like a tire).
steps.content: Stand the diaper tire on its side (so it now looks like a tire). Join the blanket from the first diaper tire to the second tire. Align the tires next to each other so they form the base of the motorcycle. Tuck the end of the blanket into the hole of the second diaper tire. Pull gently so the blanket easily holds the two tires in place. Add a pin on the ends of the blanket to ensure the blanket stays in place inside the tires.

steps.title: Fold the second blanket in half length-wise.
steps.content: Fold the second blanket in half length-wise. Then roll the blanket the same way you rolled the first blanket.

steps.title: Place the blanket into the opening of the front tire.
steps.content: Place the blanket into the opening of the front tire. Slide the blanket completely through the hole until both blanket ends meet.

steps.title: Pin the bib to the top of the front diaper tire.
steps.content: Pin the bib to the top of the front diaper tire. Keep the graphic or child’s name visible and facing outward.

steps.title: Hold the ends of the front diaper tire blanket upward.
steps.content: Hold the ends of the front diaper tire blanket upward. Slide the ring toy through the top so they hold the two blanket ends. Slide the toy until it is almost all the way down to the diaper tire.

steps.title: Insert the baby bottle above the bib and underneath the ring toy.
steps.content: Insert the baby bottle above the bib and underneath the ring toy. Check that it fits snugly.

steps.title: Create more definition and strength in the handlebars.
steps.content: Create more definition and strength in the handlebars. Slide a small piece of rolled-up light cardboard inside each handlebar roll.

steps.title: Stuff the baby socks with a small amount of tissue paper to puff up the garment.
steps.content: Stuff the baby socks with a small amount of tissue paper to puff up the garment.

steps.title: Top the handlebars with one sock on each side.
steps.content: Top the handlebars with one sock on each side. Try to pin in place if they don’t hold naturally.

steps.title: Add the second bib to the back diaper tire the same way you added the first bib to the front.
steps.content: Add the second bib to the back diaper tire the same way you added the first bib to the front.

steps.title: Prop the stuffed toy on top so it appears that the toy is riding the motorcycle.
steps.content: Prop the stuffed toy on top so it appears that the toy is riding the motorcycle. You may need to pin the toy in place, especially if the toy is pliable.

steps.title: Finished.
steps.content: Finished. You now have a fun, cute and very useful gift to give to the expectant mom.
